title.narrative: Strengthening of Office of the Minister of State for Administrative Reform , phase 2

description.narrative: Supporting civil service reform initiatives undertaken by OMSAR to modernize public sector organizations through the latest management and ICT tools to further improve their service delivery and facilitate the fulfillment of their missions.

participating-org.narrative: LEB-OFFICE OF THE MINISTER OF STATE FOR ADMINISTRATIVE REFORM

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: No. of policy reforms legislated and implementation plans adopted

comment.narrative: Administrative Reform Strategy adopted by Office of the State for Administrative Reform in 2012, small and medium enterprise strategy developed in 2014, Statistical Master plan developed (2015)

1.1 Follow-up on the ratification of public procurement regulations and conduct activities to support the execution of public contracts in compliance with international standards pertaining to fairness and efficiency. 1.2Follow-up on the ratification of laws and regulations that serve the execution of the e-Government program with special focus on the e-transaction law, unique ID number, privacy law, cyber security and interoperability. 1.3 Support the adoption of the required legal frameworks of the anticorruption basket of draft laws, mainly: Illicit enrichment; conflicts of interest; access to information; and whistle blowers protection. 1.4 Introduce modern structures and review mandates and roles of the control bodies and other relevant public administrations. 1.5 Develop a methodology for Regulatory Impact assessment and adopt it to relevant draft laws and decrees under preparation. 2.1 Develop strategic planning capacities in the public administration. 2.2 Introduce internal control functions in the public administration. 2.3 Identify potential for outsourcing some government functions and activities to the private sector. 2.4 Promote the adoption of sectoral and organizational Performance Evaluation methodologies at the Central Inspection. 2.5 Support the CAS in producing economic, social, gender, poverty statistics in addition to strengthening the management of statistical surveys. 2.6 Launch and implement a Performance Improvement Planning Project (PIP) in three public entities.3.1 Support the CSB, ENA and the Lebanese ministries (starting with the four pilot ministries) in adopting modern HR practices. 3.1 Support the CSB, ENA and the Lebanese ministries (starting with the four pilot ministries) in adopting modern HR practices. 3.2 Reinforce the training function of OMSAR and continue the training activities at both the administrative and ICT levels. 3.3 Reinforce the adoption of job descriptions. 3.4 Support the efforts of the Government to apply the mechanism of the recruitment / appointment of senior government staff based on merit standards. 4.1 Streamline government services and simplify number of critical services. 4.2 Establishing one-stop shops (single window service) in relevant ministries Established. 5.1 Adopt Digital Government Strategy with needed commitments and endorsements. 5.2 Improve the E-Government Infrastructure (Secure Government Network, Failover data center, Gateways for Interoperability, Payment and Authentication) 5.3 Complete the E-Government Legal Framework 5.4 Enhance the automation of back offices in order to improve their readiness for e-services 5.5 Enhance and Promote the E-Government Portal – DAWLATI (better enrollment and better authentication, integration of billing information and payment, improvement of the mobile features of DAWLATI) 5.6 Improve the Interoperability and the exchange of information between different public administrations 5.7 Establishing the required ICT infrastructure of H/W network. 5.8 Implementing Workflow and DMS Systems 5.9 Implementing line of business MIS applications. 5.10 Development of ICT standards and promoting best practices of managing ICT resources (ICT Standards, Datacenter Standards, Workflow/DMS Standards) 5.11 Deployment of Website standards to new sites. 6.1 6.1 Technical and Administrative support provided to Municipalities and Unions of Municipalities to alleviate the Solid Waste Crisis and ensure the proper execution of awarded contracts in the scope of SWAM1 and SWAM 2 6.2 Enhance the technical and administrative capacities of the Municipal staff 6.3 Enhance and Support the maintenance and Management of solid waste facilities deployed by OMSAR. 6.4 Support CSOs in implementing projects of socio-economic nature. 6.5 Strengthen CSOs and related stakeholders + awareness campaigns 7.1 Support Municipal Unions in the local planning and local development 7.2 Citizens / Client oriented management 7.3 Organizational strengthening 7.4 Personnel and human resources development 7.5 Financial management 7.6 Internal control, monitoring and evaluation

In 2018, the following main results were achieved by output 102276: • Launching the anti-corruption strategy and the operational plan. • Launching the digital transformation strategy. • Contribute to the enactment of the Law on the protection of whistleblowers. • Completion of a study for regulatory impact assessment and its application to a number of departments • Development of an e-procurement system • Development of a charter for integrity in public procurement • Completion of 10 advanced training courses on public procurements attended by 600 trainees. • Under AfKAR program: the development of a training manual for training of trainers on policy dialogue between the public sector and civil society and on capacity development for civil society organizations. In addition, to the completion of 13 projects for civil society organizations funded by the EU. • Under the solid waste program: the establishment of solid waste treatment facilities, including the sorting and composting plants, the sanitary landfills, and the supply of modern equipment through EU grants in around four locations. • Financing and supervising the management (operation and maintenance) of solid waste management facilities funded by the Lebanese budget for 14 solid waste facilities. • Production of six reports reflecting the measurement and evaluation of the administrative and organizational performance for six departments based on the developed indicators. • Provide the central inspection with an operational mechanism to monitor the performance of public administrations, institutions and municipalities based on KPIs. • Follow-up on the implementation of the technical assistance for CAS in the areas of improving national accounts and social statistics. • Initiate the development of change management action plans in nine departments as a practical result of the implementation of the first module of the course titled "Successful management of Change " in collaboration with a team of Dutch coaches. • E-Training project: additional numbers of public sector employees enter the e-Training portal established by the Ministry of State for Administrative development, bringing the number of trainees to 1475. • Court Automation software has been deployed in several courts and some courts will be fully automated early 2019. • Under the support to the National social security fund: completion of the strategic Plan and operational plan, completion of the information and communications technology systems induction plan, finalization of the human resources management policy and the preparation of the new organizational structure of the Job description cards. • Continue the restoration of the civil registry records. • Equipping public administrations with 5,200 copies of the Antivirus License. • Implementation of Microsoft Products & Services Agreement that included the purchase and installation of the latest Microsoft Licenses (Servers) in priority government locations. • Implementation of Information Center and infrastructure project (data center and Infrastructure) at CDR. • Installation of Security Appliances in several government entities. • Continue the technical support and webhosting services for the public entities.

Legal framework for Anti-corruption Accountability and oversight Transparency in budgeting and financial reporting Transparency in public procurement Digitalization of PA and public services Information base and access to information

New strategic plan (mission, vision statements, updated principles & values, strategic goals & objectives ) for OMSAR (2020 – 2027) A draft law (قانون معجل مكرر) to legalize the Appointment Mechanism in Lebanese Public Administrations and Institutions. Develop and enhance the Anti-Corruption Strategy in terms of making it more in line with international standards mainly the United Nations Convention Against Corruption. Together with Gherbal, The project developed a guide for Access to Information Law targeting citizens Revamp digital transformation strategy and action plan 2020-2030

. Follow-up on the ratification of public procurement regulations and conduct activities to support the execution of public contracts in compliance with international standards pertaining to fairness and efficiency . Support the adoption of the required legal frameworks of the anti corruption basket of draft laws, mainly: Illicit enrichment; conflicts of interest; access to information; and whistle blowers protection. . Introduce modern structures and review mandates and roles of the control bodies and other relevant public administrations. . Develop a methodology for Regulatory Impact assessment and adopt it to relevant draft laws and decrees under preparation. . Develop strategic planning capacities in the public administration . Identify potential for outsourcing some government functions and activities to the private sector . Promote the adoption of sectoral and organizational Performance Evaluation methodologies at the Central Inspection . Support the CAS in producing economic, social, gender, poverty statistics in addition to strengthening the management of statistical surveys . Launch and implement a Performance Improvement Planning Project (PIP) in three public entities. . Establishing one-stop shops (single window service) in relevant ministries Established . Adopt Digital Government Strategy with needed commitments and endorsements . Improve the E-Government Infrastructure (Secure Government Network, Fail over data center, Gateways for Interoperability, Payment and Authentication) . Enhance and Promote the E-Government Portal – DAWLATI (better enrollment and better authentication, integration of billing information and payment, improvement of the mobile features of DAWLATI) . Citizens / Client oriented management . Technical and Administrative support provided to Municipalities and Unions of Municipalities to alleviate the Solid Waste Crisis and ensure the proper execution of awarded contracts in the scope of SWAM1 and SWAM 2 . Implementing Workflow and DMS Systems

• Develop and enhance the Anti-Corruption Strategy in terms of making it more in line with international standards mainly the United Nations Convention Against Corruption. • Submission of the updated version of the National Anti-corruption Strategy to the Prime Minister’s Office on 23 September 2019. • Preparatory workshops with Public Administrations required to apply the law and more than 100 public officials attended the workshop. • Together with Gherbal, OMSAR developed a guide for Access to Information Law targeting citizens • UNCAC coordination: OMSAR reactivated the role of the National Team to follow up on the events related to UNCAC and clarified the coordination role that should be in place in order to guarantee proper representation of Lebanon in the related conferences and events. • Access to Information Law: OMSAR, through the joint support of UNDP under ACT Project and OECD, developed a national action plan to enhance the implementation of the law. • E-procurement system English version finalized; Arabic translation subject to last round of verification; • Courses on Bidding Documents and Evaluation translated using own resources • E-learning course on Evaluation being developed (80% complete) • Integrity Guidelines translated using own resources (50% complete) • Training of State Council and Civil Appeal clerks on the use of the system by the OMSAR team • The Contract is closed and OMSAR team is following up on the roll out to other courts and sustainability of the project
